title: How to Wear a Wig When You Have Long Hair

steps.title: Divide your hair into 2 or 4 sections, depending on how thick your hair is.
steps.content: Divide your hair into 2 or 4 sections, depending on how thick your hair is. If your hair isn't too thick, divide your hair down the middle from front to back. If you have thicker hair, divide each side into 2 sections vertically so you have 4 sections. [1] X Research source Tie each section up loosely with a hair tie.

steps.title: Braid each section loosely.
steps.content: Braid each section loosely. [2] X Expert Source Nikia Londy Hair Augmentation Specialist Expert Interview. 7 October 2021. Start the braids down near the base of your scalp. If you're just doing 2 braids, you can start each one just behind your ears. To braid the hair, divide it into 3 sections, a left, middle, and right section. Bring the right over the middle, making it the middle section. Bring the left over the middle, making it the middle section. Continue alternating back and forth until you've braided the hair all the way down. Secure it with a small hair tie. You're going to be wrapping the braids around your head, and loose braids will make this process easier. If you braid it too tightly, it may create lumps under the wig.

steps.title: Wrap 1 braid around your head.
steps.content: Wrap 1 braid around your head. Take one of the braids you just made and wrap it around the crown of your head, then secure the braid at the back of your head with a bobby pin. Continue wrapping the braid up and toward the front of your head until the whole braid is resting against your scalp. However, stop wrapping a few finger-lengths away from the front of your scalp so the braid won't show under the front of the wig. Once the entire braid is wrapped, add bobby pins all around the braid until it stays in place. [3] X Research source Try to keep the braid as close to your head as possible. If you have 4 braids, start with one of the back braids first.

steps.title: Position the other braids around your head.
steps.content: Position the other braids around your head. [4] X Expert Source Nikia Londy Hair Augmentation Specialist Expert Interview. 7 October 2021. Take the other braid in the back and wrap it the other direction, placing it just underneath the first braid. Pin it in place with bobby pins as you go, finishing the wrap around the front, just like the other braid. Don't overlap braids, as that will create lumps. If you have 4 braids, wrap the other braids around your hair where they will fit and pin them in place. You can also use hair pins instead of bobby pins, which may help if you are having trouble getting your hair to stay in place, as they are a bit larger than bobby pins.

steps.title: Use a comb to divide the hair into small rows one at a time.
steps.content: Use a comb to divide the hair into small rows one at a time. Section off a small area of hair, making a line down your scalp from front to back. Start on one side of your head and work across. The section of hair should only be about 1 to 2 inches (2.5 to 5.1 cm) across. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Begin the cornrow braids by dividing an area into 3 small sections.
steps.content: Begin the cornrow braids by dividing an area into 3 small sections. Start at the front of your scalp with 1 row and create 3 even sections from just the very front part of the row. Pass the right section under the middle section, making it the middle section. Pass the left under the middle, making it the middle section. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Add hair to each side of the braid.
steps.content: Add hair to each side of the braid. Pull in hair to the right section from the row you're working on. Add hair to the left side, also from the row you're working on. This is much like a French braid, but you're working the hair under the cornrows instead of over. [7] X Research source You only need to add the next little bit of hair, maybe 0.5 in (1.3 cm) or so.

steps.title: Continue braiding down the section, then secure it with a hair tie.
steps.content: Continue braiding down the section, then secure it with a hair tie. Keep braiding down the line of hair you've created. When you reach the base of your scalp, add any hair left in that section to the braid and make a regular braid the rest of the way down. Use a small hair tie to hold it in place. [8] X Research source Use as small a hair tie as possible so it won't create lumps.

steps.title: Repeat in small sections across your scalp.
steps.content: Repeat in small sections across your scalp. Working from side to side, continue to divide and braid small sections of your hair. When you're finished, the braids should form a series of neat rows running from the front of your head to the back of your hairline. Secure each one with a hair tie. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Pin the braids up into your hair.
steps.content: Pin the braids up into your hair. [10] X Expert Source Nikia Londy Hair Augmentation Specialist Expert Interview. 7 October 2021. Twist several tails together and then wrap them around the back of your head near the base of the scalp. Pin them in place with large bobby pins. Do the same with the rest of the braid tails, trying not to overlap them. [11] X Research source If your braid tails are especially thick, you can pin them up individually.

steps.title: Pull a wig cap over your head.
steps.content: Pull a wig cap over your head. [12] X Expert Source Nikia Londy Hair Augmentation Specialist Expert Interview. 7 October 2021. Typically, these have 2 holes, 1 with an elastic edge. Put your head through both holes so the cap is around your neck. Rearrange the cap so the elastic will be at the front of your scalp when you pull it up, meaning the bulk of the cap will be towards the back of your head. [13] X Research source Another kind of wig cap fits like a winter hat, meaning it just has one hole that fits over your whole head. Pull it on over all your hair at once. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Draw the cap over your head.
steps.content: Draw the cap over your head. Pull the back of the cap, the non-elastic side, up over your hair. Draw it all the way to the back of your hair. As you do, make sure you don't pull the elastic edge past the front of your scalp. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Tuck the hair in the front.
steps.content: Tuck the hair in the front. [16] X Expert Source Nikia Londy Hair Augmentation Specialist Expert Interview. 7 October 2021. Use your fingers to tuck your sideburns under the front edge of the wig cap, then pull the elastic part behind your ears. Make sure the front edge is in place across the front part of your hair. [17] X Research source If you have the other kind of wig cap, use your fingers to tuck any stray hairs up under the wig. [18] X Research source

steps.title: Pull the bottom half of the wig cap up over the back of your hair.
steps.content: Pull the bottom half of the wig cap up over the back of your hair. [19] X Expert Source Nikia Londy Hair Augmentation Specialist Expert Interview. 7 October 2021. Keeping the elastic in place all around the edge of your scalp, draw up the back half of the wig cap from the base of your skull. As you pull up, the back end should elongate, and you'll have the back hole of the wig in your hand. Draw the end of the cap up to the crown of your head and secure it with bobby pins or a hair clip. [20] X Research source In other words, you're going to close off the back hole by pulling it out like a sock or a stocking cap and attaching the end to the top of your head.

steps.title: Stretch the wig over your head.
steps.content: Stretch the wig over your head. Use your fingers to stretch out the elastic band around the edge of the wig. Pull it on over your braids so that the braids are all underneath it. Lift up the wig hair in places and stick in bobby pins through the mesh to attach the wig to your head. If you want, you can use double-sided fashion tape to secure the edge of the wig. If you're planning on wearing a wig long-term, you can glue it on. However, if you've never done it before, you should have a professional show you how, as you don't want to get the glue in your own hair. Also, ask the stylist for product recommendations to ensure you choose the right type of adhesive. [21] X Research source
